title: [QUESTION] Support for RGB/BGR 24 bytes per pixel format?
body:
I am trying to get some pixel data into an `SKImage` or `SKBitmap` for drawing it to a canvas without having to perform an expensive copy to a 4 channel format or encoding/decoding the image. This pixel data is the same format that a `System.Drawing.Bitmap` with `PixelFormat.Format24bppRgb` uses. It seems that `SKImageInfo` is not able to represent this pixel format though.

Here is the line I'm using to make my SKImageInfo:
```csharp
SKImageInfo info = new SKImageInfo(myImage.Width, myImage.Height, SKColorType.Rgb888x, SKAlphaType.Opaque);
```

This results in an SKImageInfo that has `BytesPerPixel = 4`.  
I can't find any other color type that would match this pixel format with 3 bytes per pixel, even though this is a very common format that .bmp files store internally. (BGR vs RGB aside)

Are 24bpp RGB/BGR bitmaps not supported?  
Is there a way to construct an SKImageInfo that has `BytesPerPixel = 3` and its other properties with the specific values I need?
